section.title: Introduction
section.t: To address the requirement of an NFS protocol that can evolve as the need arises, the Network File System (NFS) version 4 (NFSv4) protocol contains the rules and framework to allow for future minor changes or versioning. These versioning rules SHOULD maintain compatibility with existing clients and servers.

A large portion of such changes will be part of new minor versions. The COMPOUND procedure (see Section 14.2 of ) specifies the minor version being used by the client. The CB_COMPOUND (see Section 15.2 of ) procedure specifies the minor version being used by the server on callbacks.

In addition to the creation of new minor versions, two other sorts of versioning are discussed in this document:
Addition of OPTIONAL features to existing minor versions.
XDR-based extensions used to correct protocol bugs in existing minor versions or associated features.
